title: IT campus hiring to soar 25% this fiscal led by TCS, Infosys & Wipro
description: Experts say the hiring of fresh talent is a positive sign for the IT sector, which reduced or paused fresh intakes from campuses last year amid global economic uncertainties and to stabilise their workforces after aggressive hiring during the pandemic.
content: IT campus hiring is expected to surge 20-25% this fiscal, backed by growing demand for talent in AI, cybersecurity, cloud computing, and data analytics, industry experts told ET. Companies are likely to bolster their workforces led by top software services firms such as Tata Consultancy Services, Infosys, Wipro, HCLTech, Tech Mahindra.Experts say the hiring of fresh talent is a positive sign for the IT sector, which reduced or paused fresh intakes from campuses last year amid global economic uncertainties and to stabilise their workforces after aggressive hiring during the pandemic.“We're expecting fresher hiring to grow by 20-25% this year compared to FY24. Last year, hiring slowed due to global economic uncertainties, but 2024-25 is showing signs of recovery,” said Krishna Vij, vice president at TeamLease Digital.Last year, despite robust recruitment projections, only around 80,000 freshers were hired, with many companies not honouring previous offers due to market uncertainties, said Vij.Companies are currently placing a greater emphasis on fresh talent to drive digital transformation initiatives, fill skill gaps, and reduce reliance on experienced lateral hires, according to experts.
